turns.content:
The North American Telugu Society (NATS) is a non-profit organization formed in 2009 by 200 volunteers with the aim of serving Telugu communities across North America. NATS conducts various cultural, spiritual, social, and educational activities and works to preserve, propagate, and perpetuate Telugu cultural heritage in North America. The organization has a 24x7 helpline (1-888-483-5848) to provide immediate assistance to anyone in need. NATS holds a bi-annual 3-day convention attended by approximately 8000 people to celebrate Telugu culture, which includes cultural, literary, business symposiums, shark tanks, continuing education classes, women's forums, and career development for the younger generation.

Sambaralu is a cultural event held as part of NATS' bi-annual convention. It is a celebration of Telugu culture, including music, dance, food, and traditions. The event is a gathering of Telugu people living in North America and is a way to preserve, propagate, and perpetuate Telugu cultural heritage. Sambaralu is an important part of NATS' mission to serve the Telugu community and provide a platform for Telugu people to come together and celebrate their culture.

The North American Telugu Society (NATS) conducts various events throughout the year to serve and engage the Telugu community in the US. Some of the events include:

1. Bi-Annual Conventions: NATS holds a bi-annual 3-day convention to celebrate Telugu culture and heritage with thousands of attendees. The convention includes cultural, literary, and business symposiums, shark tanks, continuing education classes, women's forums, and career development programs.
2. Million Can Drive: NATS organizes a Million Can Drive every year across the US to collect food items for local food banks and shelters.
3. Cultural programs: NATS promotes Telugu cultural heritage by conducting classical dance and music programs, folk arts and theater performances.
4. Educational programs: NATS conducts seminars, workshops, and training programs on various topics such as financial planning, career development, and health and wellness.
5. Community service: NATS is involved in various community service activities, including volunteering at local shelters, food banks, and schools.
6. Sports and recreation: NATS organizes sports events such as cricket tournaments, outdoor activities, and cultural games to promote healthy living and encourage community building.

These events provide a platform for Telugu people living in North America to connect, engage, and celebrate their culture and heritage.
why should president obama attend NATS

It would be an honor for the North American Telugu Society (NATS) if President Obama could attend our upcoming annual convention as our chief guest. The NATS is a non-profit organization that serves the Telugu community in North America through cultural, spiritual, social, and educational activities. Our annual convention is a celebration of Telugu culture and brings together over 8000 people to participate in various cultural, literary, business, and educational events.

Attending NATS would provide President Obama with an opportunity to interact with the Telugu community and gain a deeper understanding of their cultural heritage and values. Additionally, his presence at the event would be a great source of inspiration for the attendees and serve as a testament to the significant contributions made by the Telugu community in North America. Overall, President Obama's attendance at NATS would be a meaningful and memorable experience for both the organization and the community.

Subject: Invitation to Attend North American Telugu Society Convention

Dear President Obama,

I hope this email finds you well. I am writing on behalf of the North American Telugu Society (NATS), a non-profit organization formed to serve Telugu communities across North America through cultural, spiritual, social, and educational activities.

We are proud to announce our 7th annual convention, taking place at the Raritan Convention Center from May 26th to 28th. This three-day event is a celebration of Telugu culture and heritage and is attended by thousands of people from across the country.

It would be an honor to have you attend our event as our special guest. Your presence would inspire and encourage the Telugu community and your speech would be a great source of motivation for everyone. We believe that your unique perspective and experience as a former president of the United States would be a valuable contribution to our convention.

Please let us know if you are interested in attending and if you have any specific requirements. We would be happy to accommodate your needs and arrange for a VIP experience.

Thank you for considering our invitation and I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
[Your name]
[NATS representative]
invite aruna miller to NATS convention

Dear Aruna Miller,

Greetings from North American Telugu Society (NATS), a non-profit organization formed in 2009 to serve the Telugu communities across North America through cultural, spiritual, social, and educational activities.

We are honored to invite you to our upcoming 7th annual NATS convention, which will be held from May 26th-28th at the Raritan Convention Center. This three-day mega event is an opportunity to celebrate Telugu culture and will include various cultural, literary, business symposiums, shark tanks, continuing education classes, women's forums, and career development for the younger generation.

As an accomplished leader and influencer, your presence at the convention would be a great source of inspiration and motivation for our attendees. We would be honored to hear from you about your experiences and perspectives during a speaking session on the mainstage.

Please let us know if you are available to attend and if you have any further questions about the convention. We look forward to your positive response.

Best regards,
[Your Name and NATS Representative]
invitation letter for telugu actor pavan kalyan from NATS

Dear Pavan Kalyan,

Greetings from the North American Telugu Society (NATS)! We are a non-profit organization formed in 2009 by 200 volunteers of similar values to serve Telugu communities across North America through cultural, spiritual, social, and educational activities.

We are pleased to invite you as a special guest to our upcoming convention, which is going to be held at the Raritan Convention Center from May 26-28. This three-day mega event includes various cultural, literary, business symposiums, shark tanks, continuing Education classes, Women's forums, and career development for the younger generation. We believe that your presence will inspire and motivate thousands of our attendees, who are eagerly waiting to meet and interact with you.

As an esteemed actor in the Telugu film industry, we are confident that your presence will enhance the cultural significance of our event. We would be honored if you could address our gathering during the mainstage event and share your experience and insights. We also request you to participate in our various cultural and social activities and interact with our attendees to promote and preserve Telugu cultural heritage in North America.

We appreciate your time and consideration of our invitation. We are eagerly looking forward to your response and hope that you will accept our invitation to attend our convention.

Warm regards,

[Your Name]
On behalf of the North American Telugu Society (NATS)
invitation letter for telugu actor vishwak sen from NATS

Dear Vishwak Sen,

I am writing to invite you as a guest of honor to our upcoming NATS convention. North American Telugu Society (NATS) is a non-profit organization that aims to serve Telugu communities across North America through cultural, spiritual, social, and educational activities. Our flagship has been the 24x7 helpline 1-888-483-5848 that provides immediate assistance to anyone needing help.

Every year, we organize a 3-day convention where thousands of people come together to celebrate Telugu culture, exchange ideas, and network with fellow Telugu-speaking professionals. This year, we are thrilled to celebrate our 7th annual convention at the Raritan Convention Center from May 26-28. We would be honored to have you as our guest of honor, share your experiences with our attendees, and inspire our younger generation.

We believe that your presence will add immense value to our event, and your insights and experiences as a successful actor will be a great inspiration to our attendees. We would be delighted to have you join us and would appreciate a prompt response regarding your availability. Thank you in advance for considering our invitation, and we look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
[Your Name]
invitation letter to telugu film director Sekhar Kammula

Dear Sekhar Kammula,

I am writing to extend a warm invitation to you as a guest of honor to our upcoming convention. North American Telugu Society (NATS) is a non-profit organization that strives to serve Telugu communities across North America through cultural, spiritual, social, and educational activities.

As an accomplished and talented Telugu film director, we believe that your presence would be a great source of inspiration and motivation for our attendees. Our convention is going to be held at the Raritan Convention Center from May 26-28 and includes various cultural, literary, business symposiums, shark tanks, continuing education classes, women's forums, and career development opportunities for the younger generation.

We would be honored to have you share your experiences and insights with our attendees during the mainstage event. Your presence at our convention would add immense value to our event, and we are confident that our attendees will be delighted to have the opportunity to meet and interact with you.

Please let us know if you are available to attend and if you have any further questions about the convention. We look forward to your positive response.

Best regards,
[Your Name]
On behalf of the North American Telugu Society (NATS)
